Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; interior glazed (fired brown) with traces of two added red bands; exterior: black band above black-figure decoration consisting of part of siren's outspread left wing with red at centre; at right, part of siren (head with polos cap, chest and part of left wing remaining), to left; incised splinter rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, pl XVIII, no. 52)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.118, no. A200)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.259) (phase 3)
